post.body: I can see where that would be true. When you really like what you do it's not work!
You're pretty busy then!
Blue spruce is a great sedum. We really like ours. It did well in a pot outside for years before we planted it outside.
Thanks! I've thought about the GC profession before. Do you do it as part time or full time?
I tend to do the same. I sacrifice the inside for the outside all the time.
CA makes sense.I've heard there are some that are hardy here in TN but never investigated.Too many other things to plant 1st
Are bananas hardy where you are?
I suspect that if you pay attention to the ratings you probably come out ahead.
Of course jumping on shrubs probably hurts so it's a good idea I didn't. ;)
I've wondered about Ebay plants and seeds. I had my eye on a variegated red twig dogwood but never jumped on it.
The more you root the more you have for decorations!
You're aloud to do that every once in a awhile!
Did it melt? ;)
The End and The Beginning: Today is the last day of 2008 but unless you've never seen a calander you probably kn.. http://tinyurl.com/7nux4x
Time to get busy around the house. Signing Off.
Garden Coaches: Pimp My Yard?: OK, I wouldn't have titled the article with Pimp My Yard (I'm really not cool eno.. http://tinyurl.com/9mqo96
Sedums in the Garden: The Plant of the Month for December over at Gardening Gone Wild is all about sedums! .. http://tinyurl.com/87dbk5
Signing off, time to get dinner ready!
In the warm nearly 70 degree weather I dug a new garden bed for self seeding annuals! The dirt will need turned again but it's a start!
Warm day ahead 62, good day to get outside!
